tool.name: Prune Phytab Boot
tool.description: Removes bootstrap probabilities (support values) below user-defined threshold

param.name: input
param.label: Tabular file with bootstrap probabilities in the last column

param.name: prob
param.label: Remove trees with bootstrap probabilities below this value (from 0 to 100)

data.name: output
data.label: tabular file output with bootstrap probabilities above or equal to threshold

tool.help:
**What it does**
Takes tabular file with bootstrap probabilities in the last column and outputs the same tabular file, but without the lines containing bootstrap probabilities below user-defined value.
Designed to be used in conjunction with phytab_raxml_boot_avg, which calculates mean probabilities per RAxML tree.
------
**Inputs**
Tabular file; with each line formatted as follows (not including quotes): "[name of tree] [bootstrap probability]".
------
**Outputs**
Tabular file; each line is formatted as follows (not including quotes): "[name of tree] [bootstrap probability]". Does not contain line with bootstrap probabilities below user-defind threshold.
-------
**Additional Information**
Requires Python 2.
Please direct questions or comments to ucsb_phylogenetics@lifesci.ucsb.edu or, if you can, enter them on the osiris_phylogenetics site at bitbucket.org
-------
**Citations**
This tool is part of the Osiris Phylogenetics Tool Package for Galaxy. If you make extensive use of this tool in a publication, please consider citing it.
Current Osiris Citation is here
http://osiris-phylogenetics.blogspot.com/2012/10/citation.html
